channel.title: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them
channel.description:
Just a few things: featured tracks are not really intended for remixing. Even then, I'd say about 75% of those people who remix tracks do it just for the sake of remixing, or because they really like the song, and don't actually change anything about the song save for a few changes in the instruments playing the already given loops. Uploading these "remixes" is basically just plagiarism, and I've already made clear my stance on that. Another problem: screen capturing artwork and using it without permission. This has been an incredibly common thing to do. Artists or people they hire take a long time to create that, and if you take it and use it for purposes such as artwork for SoundCloud, however much you altered it in any way, is illegal, especially without asking, (1) and without giving credit for the original photo (2). And if you steal both the music AND the artwork, then that's obviously illegal. (I'll just add that it should go without saying that you DEFINITELY CAN NOT upload to anything that you can make money off of, such as iTunes, Spotify, or Youtube unless you get direct permission to do so from the original artist) also, with Youtube: don't just straight up upload tracks from the featured tracks list in the app, even if you can't make money off of it.
BOTTOM LINE: Don't upload any remix, edit, or flip to ANYTHING without the artist giving you permission. Change more than instruments in any remix (try changing notes, automations for a change!). Get the artwork from the ARTIST ONLY with permission. And finally, try learning from a track instead of just wanting to remix it right away.
Don't get me wrong, I really would love to see a remix with all of the above rules met. Get creative! Thanks guys!

item.title: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Remember that the projects in the feed are released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 License, which means that what you can do and not do with a featured track is covered by the license. I recommend that you read the full license and make sure you understand it before sharing tracks using it.

The same license could be applied to artworks, but remember that as long as you don’t explicitly know which license an image has, you should assume that is “All Rights Reserved”, which means you cannot use it for your own work.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them

item.title: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them
item.dc:creator: NEWNAMES
item.description:
As long as you say it’s a bootleg remix, I think it’s completely fine. I mean, as long as you give credit to the original artist.

I’m actually planning on doing a few bootleg remixes with Auxy and FL for audio so I might be biased. =P

Read full topic
item.source: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them

item.title: What to do with Featured tracks and how to remix them
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Possibly stupid question, but what are people’s views on bootleg remixes - especially of tracks by major recording artists?

Always bad? No exceptions?

 
(To be clear, I think taking someone’s work and simply rebadging it as your own is disgusting, low and unacceptable.)

Read full topic
